title: Citibank Korea Supports Women-Owned SMEs with USD 260,000 Grant
summary: Citibank Korea is supporting the 2011 Women-Owned Enterprise Competitiveness Enhancement Program organized by Korea Small Business Institute (KOSBI) with a USD 260,000 grant from Citi Foundation.
tag-1: Citibank Korea Supports Women-Owned SMEs with USD 260,000 Grant
tag-2: Citibank Korea is supporting the 2011 Women-Owned Enterprise Competitiveness Enhancement Program organized by Korea Small Business Institute (KOSBI) with a USD 260,000 grant from Citi Foundation.
tag-3: On April 13 in Lexington Hotel, Central Part Hall, more than 80 people attended the sponsorship signing ceremony, including KOSBI President Chang, EVP Kim Myung-Ok of Citibank Korea, Division Head Choi Soo-Gyu of Small & Medium Business Administration, and Senior Vice Chairperson Lee Geum-Seon of Korean Women Entrepreneurs Association, along with program organizers and course participants.
tag-4: Citi has been supporting the program since 2007. The program aims to develop role models for women-owned small and medium enterprises (SMEs) and improve their competitive edge globally. Led by KOSBI, the 2011 program will focus on strengthening the competitiveness of women-led businesses on the international stage. Citi's grant will go towards supporting the Citi-KOSBI Women-owned Enterprise Academy, Citi-KOSBI Women Entrepreneurs' Award and networking activities among local and foreign women business owners.
tag-5: Kim Myung-Ok, Citibank Korea said, "We expect this program to greatly help nurture talented Korean women CEOs and enhance their standing in society. Citibank remains committed to strengthening women's rights and competitiveness in our society."
tag-6: "With Korea's aging population and low birth rates, it is paramount that we show our support for women-owned companies at this point in time. I hope this program will contribute significantly to the development of the female workforce," said KOSBI President Jang.
tag-7: After the signing ceremony, attendees were introduced to the fourth Citi-KOSBI Women-owned Enterprise Academy. Targeted at SME women leaders, the program will be held April 7 to July 14 at the KOSBI office in Yoido. The 14-week course will include 22 classes, including elementary classes on leadership, culture management, marketing and liberal arts, and advanced classes on global competence, innovation, change management, human networking and financial management.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Through Citicorp and Citi Holdings, Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
